message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.CR, cs.NE 

The paper presents a new algorithm to train a robust neural network against adversarial attacks. The algorithm is based on Bayesian Neural Network (BNN) and focuses on improving the robustness of neural networks. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), and cs.CV (Computer Vision). Additionally, the paper deals with adversarial attacks, which falls under the category of computer security. Hence, cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) is also a likely sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes a new algorithm to train neural networks, which involves modeling randomness and formulating the mini-max problem. Therefore, cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) is also a possible sub-category.
